articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks conducted a second day of probing attacks across Rafah on Wednesday, after Washington said the assault did not amount to a major ground incursion of the southern Gazan city that U.S. officials had told Israel to avoid.
articles.title: Israel sends tanks into Rafah on raids amid Gaza-wide offensive

articles.author: Jessie Pang, James Pomfret
articles.description: Fourteen Hong Kong pro-democracy activists were found guilty and two were acquitted on Thursday in a landmark subversion trial that critics say could deal another blow to the city's rule of law and its reputation as a global financial hub.
articles.title: Fourteen Hong Kong democrats found guilty in landmark subversion trial

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Bate Felix
articles.description: First results from South Africa's most competitive election since the end of apartheid were trickling in early on Thursday, after a late voting surge kept many polling stations open with snaking queues late into the night.
articles.title: South African election results trickle in after wide-open vote

articles.author: Laurie Chen, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China's military achieved its "expected goals" during two days of drills around Taiwan last week but is prepared for further action if provoked, a defence ministry spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: China's military says Taiwan drills met goals but it is ready for further action

articles.author: Xinghui Kok
articles.description: The fraught relationship between China and the United States is expected to loom over Asia's top security meeting this week, as are the wars in Ukraine and Gaza, and simmering South China Sea tensions.
articles.title: US-China, wars, and South China Sea likely to dominate Asian security meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran started on Thursday registration of candidates for an early election next month following the death of President Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash, Iranian Interior Minister Ahmad Vahidi told state TV.
articles.title: Iran registers presidential candidates for early vote after Raisi's death

articles.author: Lewis Jackson, Renju Jose
articles.description: Papua New Guinea ruled out finding survivors under the rubble of a massive landslide on Thursday, with the exact number of dead under almost two storeys of debris and mud still unknown but ranging from hundreds to thousands.
articles.title: Rescue teams don't expect to find survivors in Papua New Guinea landslide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan said on Thursday the February national election was stolen from his party, terming it the "biggest robbery on public mandate."
articles.title: Pakistan Feb election was stolen from his party, ex-PM Khan says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A group of Georgian non-governmental organisations (NGOs) said on Thursday they were preparing an appeal to the Georgian constitutional court against a foreign agent law that has sparked a political crisis, Georgian media reported.
articles.title: Georgian NGOs to challenge foreign agent law in constitutional court, ECHR

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: South Africa's Julius Malema, who quit the ruling African National Congress to form a radical leftist party, could potentially become a kingmaker or even deputy president if the ANC loses its majority as early election results suggest.
articles.title: Julius Malema: divisive EFF leader could be kingmaker in South Africa election
